title: BAN IMMUNITY
body:
With the 5 bans for each team coming, I think each team should vote on a champion to be protected from being banned. The vote will be 30 seconds long so teams can talk it out with each other, it's also after the champion declare. 

It won't be like one for all were if its 2 people who vote on the same champion and everyone else is different is randomizes it, but instead its majority wins. So, for example if 2 players choose urgot and the rest is different then the champion that cannot be banned is Urgot. If everyone chooses a different champion or if its 2 votes on one champion and 2 votes on another then it is randomized. 

If there is 10 bans all together then that would mean some champions would never be playable ( Yasuo { *cough* my summoner name *cough* }, Vayne, Zed, Syndra, etc )

If 5 bans comes I'm screwed as a Yasuo main. I can't even play him in the current ban system, so imagine when each team gets 5 bans.

*What da haters will say: OMG GOOD, I HATE YASUO AND VAYNE YOU DIRTY APE WE NEED 20 BANS*
*My response: Yasuo is the champion I preform the best with and if I can't even play the champion I am best with that is very odd. If you have a champion you always play and it's the champion that your climbing with, how would you feel if you could that play that champion again?

replies.body: Or you could diversify your champion pool so that people aren't limited in their picks/bans.
I obviously have more champions to pick after Yasuo is banned, because he always is banned. Your basically telling me to ditch my favorite champion.

I had to leave Diana and Elise behind this season because of jungle changes. They're simply not as efficient/fast as they used to be. Sure, I lament not being able to play them anymore, but I deal with it. Same thing with Vi and Graves. People seem to enjoy banning them, so I have to diversify. That's allowed me to find additional favourites. 

Think of it as an opportunity to grow and expand your horizons, as every league player must inevitably do.
Have you ever realised that people might actually want to play a certain champion that game?

Of course, but people don't always get what they want. I mean, obstinately saying "I want THIS champion", as though to expect to get everything you ask doesn't mean that the champion isn't going to stay unbanned. 

When you play the game long enough, you end up realising that you aren't always going to get to play the thing you want to. It's just a fact of life. I'm not saying it isn't a bad thing, but an intelligent and reasonable person will accept this and branch out instead of just being stubborn.

A further extension of this is one-trick-pony players. A lot of them pick out-of-meta champions like Zilean, or Annie, or Gangplank, or Ashe, and they'll usually get to play that champion because they know how the system works.

The point isn't getting what you want, the point is allowing a **reasonable **amount of play time for those who are actually decent with the champ. If you go through with the 10 bans then that would just further punish those players for simply playing the champion, That's not fair at all. If people don't like Yasuo, they should learn to play against him, I know I learned that the hard way...

People have already learned how to play against him, they just simply dont want to do it. That says a lot about the champion. Even teemo, when he was in his most annoying incarnation was not banned.

It wont punish anyone, it will simply shown Riot that some champs have problems that need to be fixed.

> [{quoted}](name=Dextix LT,realm=EUNE,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dk0vAQ0f,comment-id=00040001000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-27T08:03:07.327+0000)

> 
> It wont punish anyone, it will simply shown Riot that some champs have problems that need to be fixed.

Not to offend you, but your first sentence literally contradicted itself. If a person knows how to play against a champ, logically they'd want to play against them. It's an easy way to get fed thus carrying. The problem isn't people don't want to, the problem is people don't know how to keep him under control. In my opinion, I find it very easy to play against Yasuo.
Blitz isn't hard to play against, but I hate doing it.  Even when I'm on the winning team, those hooks just feel so bad.  It's not in the least contradictory.

You can know how to play against a champion and still find it annoying or unfun to do so.

Heck, knowing how to handle a champion doesn't mean your teammates possess the same knowledge or competency.

> [{quoted}](name=EndlessSorcerer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dk0vAQ0f,comment-id=0004000100000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-29T03:11:45.261+0000)
>
> You can know how to play against a champion and still find it annoying or unfun to do so.
> 
> Heck, knowing how to handle a champion doesn't mean your teammates possess the same knowledge or competency.

I understand what you mean when you say "annoying" but "unfun" personally doesn't click with me. If anything he's one of the funnest champs to go against because of all the counter play potential you have against him and vice versa.
Yeah, but it shouldn't be because someone on _your_ team is an asshole.

The entire point of ten bans, and the entire reason that we want it so urgently, is because a large number of people never want to see champions like Yasuo ever again.

Being able to force him through some "ban immunity" feature would defeat the entire purpose of adding more bans.


Look, imagine a game where it was possible / not punished to use a cheat which caused your opponents to lag terribly.
They might still be able to win, especially if they picked champions who didn't need fast reaction times, but either way they wouldn't be having much fun that game.
Wouldn't the person using that exploit be a despicable person?  Taking away the other players' ability to have fun just so that he can win?  Forcing them to use specific tactics to be able to overcome the huge disadvantage that they are at?

Playing Yasuo is exactly the same thing.  You are forcing the entire enemy team to not get to have fun just because you selfishly want to play that champion.

That would mean that with ten bans Yasuo can't even be considered a champion because you will never see him again...

Might aswell remove Yasuo and save Riot the work of adding more bans because in the end the outcome will be the same.

You say that like it's a bad thing.

Seriously, *a huge percentage of the playerbase* hate having Yasuo in their games.

His design is seriously unhealthy.

At least once he finally reaches 100% ban status, Riot might be forced to finally make changes to him to try to turn him into a healthy champion that people can have fun playing against.
If that happens, then his ban rate will drop and the people who want to main him will be able to play him again, but not at the expense of the other players in the game.

> [{quoted}](name=Nameless Voice,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dk0vAQ0f,comment-id=000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-26T21:05:43.889+0000)

> At least once he finally reaches 100% ban status, Riot might be forced to finally make changes to him to try to turn him into a healthy champion that people can have fun playing against.
> If that happens, then his ban rate will drop and the people who want to main him will be able to play him again, but not at the expense of the other players in the game.

I see where you're coming from, however "a huge percentage of the playerbase hate having Yasuo in their games" is completely false. Even though this may be true in low elo, you cannot punish those in that elo for playing Yasuo and winning games with him, simply because no one in that elo knows how to play against him. It's like saying Faker should be banned from the LCS because he's simply too good and no one knows how to lane against him. Yasuo already has a 50% ban rate. That's 1 Yasuo ban for every 2 games. That's utterly ridiculous. The best thing one could do if you simply hate playing against him is ban him, but to increase the amount of bans just so that "Overpowered" champs can be banned is ridiculous. This wouldn't only ruin the game for those who actually climb with Yasuo, but it would also ruin the game for those who believe that Yasuo isn't that great of a ban.
Yasuo also has an insane ban rate in platinum+ games, so saying that only low-elo players hate him is simply not true.

> [{quoted}](name=Nameless Voice,realm=EUW,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dk0vAQ0f,comment-id=00000000000000000001,timestamp=2016-12-27T05:26:00.271+0000)
>
> Yasuo also has an insane ban rate in platinum+ games, so saying that only low-elo players hate him is simply not true.

Plat isn't considered high elo.

It's the top 10%.

While it might not be as good as Diamond 1/Master/Challenger, it is still far above most of the player-base.

> [{quoted}](name=EndlessSorcerer,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dk0vAQ0f,comment-id=0000000000000000000100000000,timestamp=2016-12-29T03:12:48.587+0000)

> [{quoted}](name=I Got This,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dk0vAQ0f,comment-id=0000000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-27T01:51:34.522+0000)
>
> I see where you're coming from, however "a huge percentage of the playerbase hate having Yasuo in their games" is completely false. Even though this may be true in low elo

Hate to break it to you, but "low elo" IS a "huge percentage of the playerbase".  I can understand "balancing" around high elo, but if 80%+ of the playerbase hates a champ, then maybe it shouldn't be there.  And frankly, if you're "high elo" and only rock hard with 1 champ, then you ain't gonna go far because the high elo players can counter (like you said) and/or WILL ban Yasuo just to screw YOU (if you could somehow get to a level where you know who you're playing against).

> [{quoted}](name=HeeroTX,realm=NA,application-id=3ErqAdtq,discussion-id=dk0vAQ0f,comment-id=00000000000000000000,timestamp=2016-12-27T02:15:17.562+0000)
>
> Hate to break it to you, but "low elo" IS a "huge percentage of the playerbase".  I can understand "balancing" around high elo, but if 80%+ of the playerbase hates a champ, then maybe it shouldn't be there.  And frankly, if you're "high elo" and only rock hard with 1 champ, then you ain't gonna go far because the high elo players can counter (like you said) and/or WILL ban Yasuo just to screw YOU (if you could somehow get to a level where you know who you're playing against).

I agree that "low elo" is a huge percentage of the player base. However, 80% of players hating the champ is a huge exaggeration. Plus, you don't have to balance Yasuo in high elo, everyone there knows how to exploit him, that's why you rarely ever see him played on pro streams, LCS, etc. Saying that one-trick ponies don't make it far is in a sense disrespecting players like Adrian, who was at one point ranked third in challenger. As well as Yassuo who was also at one point challenger.

I realize people know how to handle Yasuo in high elo, that's why Riot says he's not "broken" since they balance the GAME around that elo.  What I'm saying is if a champion (Yasuo isn't the only one) is kinda broken for LOW elo (to the point that a very large percentage of people HATE playing with/against it) then maybe there's something wrong with the design of that champion, irrespective of if it is OP.
If he reaches such ban status, maybe Riot will fix him then? It worked with kassadin.

If the vast majority of players don't want to have a specific champion in their games, then that may just be an indication that there is some fundamental issue with that champion's design which may have to be addressed.

Personally, I dislike having to play with or against Yasuo and find the game far more enjoyable when he isn't in it.

Well, Riot main reason why they're even considering 10 bans is because they want every player to have a choice to ban the champ THEY PERSONALLY don't want to face. Not to perma ban certain champs.
This is true, however it is actually decent data if a champ goes to very close to permaban status. It tells them something is very wrong with that character.

Well, they're more-or-less the same thing.

Riot are implementing 10 bans so that every player gets to choose which champion they personally don't want to face.
That means that, for each individual player, it should be possible for them to permaban one champion of their choice (e.g. never see that champion in any of their games.)

It just so happens that a large number of players are going to pick Yasuo (and some other champions), because people really, *really* dislike playing against him.

> It just so happens that a large number of players are going to pick Yasuo (and some other champions), because people really, really dislike playing against him.

Don't forget to include the number of people who dislike playing _with_ him.
Totally defeats the point of bans. lol

Just keep in mind that "Playing the strong meta champion" Does not equal "Skill". If you're only doing good with the champion that's clearly been picked as one of the strongest and most hated picks in recent times then you clearly need to improve on some things.

I'll take an upvote. Tired of Darius and Ekko being banned when I feel like playing them.

Yeah well i've already given up on Rengar because he's almost perm banned and when hes not banned i skip my opportunity due to a lack of practice anyways. That and the rework kinda sucks compared to the old rengar.

With this though, you would just create a system where people would see the ban immunity, giving away the idea that you are just going to play yasou and they would pick things to counter him...

I would rather see something more along the lines of 3 bans by each team, one pick by each team, followed by another ban for each team, and then the last ban for each team. Then picks would follow as usual. 

I think this is better overall as 10 bans, especially in competitive could mean someone having their entire champ pool banned out.

I mean, if we won't see yasuo ever again, maybe Riot will do something about him? It worked with kassadin. It will work with yasuo too.

This system would defeat the whole purpose of 10 bans. Furthermore it could create such situations when a champ is CLEARLY op (Maybe even more than 1) and then you can protect him from bans all the time, and thus have him on your team, which is not good.

Forcing a system like this is more annoying given that you can already communicate what you've said to your team and even so a system like you say is unlikely to change anything about the top tier champs. Say the champ is a wildly op pick and the guy that wants it is last pick. This goes through the pick can't be banned and the other team gets it.

Bad idea with good intentions I feel. Communication is still the best method.

Completely defeats the purpose of bans. If bans can't reliably keep a champ out of the picks, then we shouldn't have them at all.

Also, I do not believe that some champs won't be playable. The only champs that reach anything close to 100% ban rate are champs that are totally broken.
I made  a proposal long ago about Yasuo, make his W instead deflect spells off it instead of making them go *poof*

this is a bad, bad idea.

What if release Kassadin happens again? What do we do, hope Riot disables him?
